properties.areaDesc: Vermillion, IN; Warren, IN; Fountain, IN; Tippecanoe, IN; Parke, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Lafayette.
* from Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the stage was 4.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 22.8 feet by Monday afternoon.
* At 22.0 feet...Extensive flooding is in progress. Flood waters block
direct access to Wabash Valley Hospital.  During agricultural
season extensive crop damage occurs. Roads that flood include N
River Rd, SR 225 south of Battleground, Stair Road, Barton Beach
Rd, Division Rd and CR 700 W at the Granville Bridge Public Access
Site and CR 950 W. Pretty Prairie Rd near Moots Creek and lowest
portion of Goldsberry Rd likely flood.  Basement flooding along N
River Road, N 9th Street and Barton Beach Rd begins.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
